Taking advantage of a fire raging through the nearby headquarters of the ruling National Democratic Party in downtown Cairo, intruders climbed the gates, broke a window and entered the museum in bid to steal the mummies. But demonstrators in collaboration with security forces stopped the thieves and returned the relics to the museum- but they were already damaged, said Zahi Hawass , head of the museum's antiquities department.`` Only their heads were intact.'' The fate of the vandals remains unknown. The Egyptian museum, which houses invaluable treasures of antiquity,
